titles: How much money should Dan give back to his little sister?
clues: But this week Dan made the worst deal ever.
This week Dan told his sister that new money was better than crumpled old money. He swapped his new £20 note for her old £50 note.
On the third week, Dan tried something different. He told Emma that green notes were better than pale orange notes. So she gave him a £10 note for his £5 note!
The second week, Dan told Emma that cute little coins were better than big heavy coins. So he traded his £1 coin for her £2 coin.
His friends said: "Dan, you pay Emma back or we'll tell your parents about your mean little deals!"
he first week, Dan swapped his 2 50p pieces for her £2 coin. He told her that it was a good deal because 2 is more than 1!
Emma doesn't know much about money, so he has been making deals with her every week for a month.
His friends asked him where he got all the cash. "From Emma, my silly little sister." Dan bragged.
Dan told his friends to order the 2 biggest ice-cream cones on the menu, and he would pay for them.
In the local sweet shop Dan was bragging to his friends.
